qas.question: By how much did crime in St. John's increase in 2009?
What city had the seventh-highest metropolitan crime index in 2010?
How much did crime in the country drop in 2009?
Where has crime been decreasing lately?
What decreased by 4% in St. John's?
What decreased by 1% in the city?

context: <b3_0>St. John's<b3_0/> has traditionally been one of the safest cities in Canada to live; however, in recent years crime in the city has steadily increased. While nationally <b4_0>crime<b4_0/> decreased by <a0_0><a2_0>4%<a2_0/><a0_0/> in 2009, the total crime rate in St. John's saw an increase of 4%. During this same time <b5_0>violent crime<b5_0/> in the city decreased 6%, compared to a 1% decrease nationally. In 2010 the total crime severity index for the city was 101.9, an increase of 10% from 2009 and 19.2% above the national average. The violent crime severity index was 90.1, an increase of 29% from 2009 and 1.2% above the national average. <a1_0>St. John's<a1_0/> had the seventh-highest metropolitan crime index and twelfth-highest metropolitan violent crime index in the country in 2010.
